intro: Aplotaxis frolowii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, containing cardiac glycosides. Aplotaxis frolowii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
